Search

The Google Search component allows users to quickly find website content. Search component is optional feature but we have included it in State Web Template. Search component requires several parts to work together. In addition to the search bar form you need to set up the Google Search ID for your domain as well as the search results page for your website.

Active search

The active (featured) search is default search bar implementation on most State Web Template pages. This implementation makes search bar visible and available in the right side of the site header.

  • Example
  • Source code
  • Nunjucks Include

Example

Screenshot

HTML Source code

HTML


    

        Custom Google Search

Nunjucks Include

Include path and usage

The Search njk include code markup:

{% include "src/_includes/search.njk" %}

Using active search include in site header

Following code (that has both the search and the site navigation includes) needs to be placed right before closing </header> tag 


     

      {% include "src/_includes/search.njk" %}
     

     {% include "src/_includes/navigation.njk" %}

Note: Path to the include will be relative to the directory of your page.

Inactive search

Another search implementation is the inactive (hidden) search bar. This implementation is used in mobile view and in pages that use Navigation with Icons site navigation type option. To activate the search bar users need to press search menu item first.

  • Example
  • Source code
  • Nunjucks Include

Example

Screenshot

Live example

HTML Source code

HTML


    

        Custom Google Search

Nunjucks Include

Include path and usage

The Search njk include code markup:

{% include "src/_includes/search.njk" %}

Using inactive search include in site header

Following code (that has both the search and the site navigation includes) needs to be placed right before closing </header> tag 


  {% include "src/_includes/navigation.njk" %}
 

  {% include "src/_includes/search.njk" %}

Note: Path to the include will be relative to the directory of your page.

Featured search

Another search implementation is the featured search bar. It's location and size make it a prominent feature on this layout option. Featured search can be only used with navicons.njk or navicons-landing.njk layouts, since paga.njk, landing.njk page layout are already using active search in their page header by default. The .featured-search classes need to be added to the #head-search div in the header of your page. It can be done by adding search: Featured paramenter to your page Front matter data.

  • Example
  • Source code
  • Nunjucks Include

Example

Screenshot

Live example of the featured search

HTML Source code

HTML


    

        Custom Google Search

Nunjucks Include

Include path and usage

The Search njk include code markup:

{% include "src/_includes/search.njk" %}

Using inactive search include in site header

Following code (that has both the search and the site navigation includes) needs to be placed right before closing </header> tag 


  {% include "src/_includes/navigation.njk" %}
 

  {% include "src/_includes/search.njk" %}

Activating Featured Search in front matter data

---
title: Featured Search
layout: navicons-landing.njk
permalink: "components/featured-search.html"
navigation: "../modules/nav-flex.html"
search: Featured
---

Note: Path to the include will be relative to the directory of your page.

Usage

When and how to use it

Search component is placed into navigation-search container which goes after Mobile Controls. Search box usually displays to the right of the site name.

On mobile, the search box becomes a search button that opens a search box. It also displays to the right of the site name.

There are two kinds of search bar implementations in State Web Template.

More on V6
